item.title: Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road Sequel Confirmed by Level-5 CEO
item.content:encoded:
Developer and publisher Level-5 has revealed that the successful soccer RPG Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road is getting a sequel, and work has already begun on drafting the script for the game.

As spotted by Automaton Media, Level-5 head Akihiro Hino confirmed the news of a sequel for the game during a recent livestream, revealing that he's personally working on a draft of the script. Naturally, it'll probably be a while before we hear anything more, since the sequel is in the drafting stage right now.

It's already been confirmed that Victory Road's massive roster of over 5,000 players can be carried over into any potential sequel that's made in the future, so if you've built an unstoppable team, you don't need to worry about losing it.

News of a sequel to Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road comes after the game recently celebrated 800,000 sales in total, as well as Level-5 revealing that a second major update is on the way later this month, adding the Ares Route to the RPG.

That sales figure follows Victory Road achieving 500,000 sales within its first week on release, thus contributing further to the Level-5 comeback that started with the success of Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time.

If you're not familiar with Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road, it's the latest entry in the Inazuma Eleven series of soccer RPGs. This one takes place 25 years after the original and focuses on new protagonist Dustin Billows (whose name is Sasanami Unmei in the original Japanese version).

Billows isn't capable of playing soccer himself, but he's determined to make a name for himself in the sport anyway, so he sets out to recruit an unbeatable team and rise to the top, embarking on his own "victory road" in the process.

You can check out Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road on PC, PlayStation, Xbox Series X|S, and both Switch 2 and Switch right now.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph
